comments.commentBody: I foresee novel treatments for male-pattern baldness!  Stop cheating on your wife and change some diapers--that will obviate the need for that comb-over!
Hope no tax dollars were spent on this  study...

We need to rethink our welfare programs, which have been subsidizing non-parenting by men, which is harmful to children, mothers, and men too.  And we need to rethink divorce laws and child support laws, and child custody laws.  Now the laws are antagonistic to the biology. We could even see crime rates go down if meb parented more and sooner.  And one must also consider the effects of delayed parenting, when there is widespread contraception, and men and women both have children at an older age, and fewer children.  What will the effects be on prostate cancer in men, and breast cancer in women, and rates of dementia and heart disease, which are accelerated by testosterone but slowed by estrogen? And one needs to examine cultures that allow polygamy , which, by simple arithmetic means that when one man gets several wives, several men get none. This may be why Islamic cultures hace so many angry young men, who then become violent terrorists.
how long before macys has a 9/11 white sale?

People-People-People.
We are now being forced to fight among ouselves.
The old "Divide and Conquer Strategy" that wins battles and wars for the other side everytime.
For those who wish to go on mourning as a means of lifetime comfort there are very fine support groups, and if there isn't one for this event then someone should start one up.
In the meantime, let those of us who have far more pressing present day issues to live with be free to use our time to think of ways to lighten our burdens, also.
Thank you for the humane consideration in this matter.
Testosterone is not the whole story. Like most fathers, I'm perfectly capable of killing if necessary to keep my family safe.  The same is probably not true of a bachelor and his BMW.

Ok, I male, don't have my own kids; I adopted a six month baby boy, and I am raising him.
I also work in a day care. So, lots of diaper, caring, ..., involved.
I play soccer and other sports; I am strong and energetic.
What the difference between me and a natural father???
This study is garbage. It smells interest groups to reduce men.
amen

There is nothing wrong with tradition, but when tradition flies in the face of common decency and turns the skies into a Walt Disney World spectacular on the Eve of a significant anniversary of one of the most tragic events in American history, tradition can and should bend.  By the way, I, too, am Catholic, and as a Catholic, I am very saddened to think that a Catholic organization would be so insensitive and put its need for bombs bursting in air ahead of showing some restraint and human kindness.  If so much time and effort went into planning the event, the event could have and should have been able to still continue in a way that doesn't offend so many other people. You didn't see local sports teams, for example, turning 9/11 and the hours leading up to it into a Fourth of July celebration. They still played their games, they still "went on with their lives" but they respected the fact that thousands of people were killed on American soil on 9/11, and that many fans were very mindful and respectful of that fact. A bigger statement a non-profit Catholic organization could make would be taking the fireworks budget on this anniversary and using it to help the poor or donating it to a program for the sick first responders. Please -- don't use my religion to justify the stupidity and insensitivity attached to your alleged tradition.

My Unfinished 9/11 Business was personal and intimate and I think courageous to share.  Past, present, future, until one goes there it is impossible to move forward.  You have an interesting perspective and it is nice that you are now able to say what you wantto say but could not say in your former position. Magical thinking that the divisions that are with us today were not present at that time of the rush to war.  There was about two minutes of unity in response to the inhumanity of 9/11 and then left and right went back to to what they have been doing.  Events have their own lives controlled by no one.

I'm afraid that nowadays the primary way people learn about Islam is by reading about the actions of Islamic terrorists in the media. This has already done much to spread a misconceived message of Islam to people around the world. Terrorism has absolutely no place in Islam. In Muslim tradition, the killing of a single innocent life equates to the killing of the entire mankind. For those who want to learn what Islam is about, read the Qur'an. You will find a religion and a way of life based on submission, surrender, and obedience in peace and sincerity to Almighty God.

I can see that most of the posters don't understand the seafood industry. It is a dirty, tedious job and the guest workers are paid between $10 - $15 an hour.

You will find that most of our "locals" who have less than high school or just high school educations shun these jobs. Why? Well because the "benefits" they are being paid by the Federal government allows them to. It was the same after Katrina. The only folks here that couldn't find a job were the ones that were not breathing any more. Yet there were our locals, sitting on the medians - waiting. They are still there - waiting!

You people amaze me. You are idolaters. Your whole life is spent building up people you don't know, and idolizing them. I'll give you facts, instead of your stupid tripe.

She was a pretty girl who married a "pretty boy". He was a silver-spoon-raised liar who stole an election. He got us involved in VN. His weak foreign policy nearly cost the world a nuclear exchange. He was a drug addict (that's what you called lush dumbaugh...good for the goose, and all...) and an adulterer. He told you "don't ask the govt for anything" after they take in all your money as taxes, and you called him a visionary patriot and genius.

She was along for the ride. That's it, in total. She never uttered a word about anything because she lived a life of undeserved privilege, and didn't care how it came about, only that it continue. She had no intention of being in a "traffic accident" like the future object of your idolatry, "lady di".

I have NO CONCERN in any way, shape or form what ANYONE connnected with that family of cheats, liars, criminals and frauds have to say. They are not "great Americans", they were anti-Americans. The fact you can't understand that is why you pay nearly 50% of your earnings in taxes to a govt that does not abide by the Constitution. You make me sick. You will be judged for it one day, like it or not.

I think this is an interesting study with lots of interesting questions to consider. And I hope many people will drop their defensiveness and simply engage in a conversation about some of the questions that arise from this report. I've thought about a couple of points after reading the article and the comments.
There is a difference between being the biological parent of a child and an active caretaking parent. It seems that the bilogoical act of fathering a child or for the mother, birthing a child, isn't the factor that affects hormone levels, but the caretaking of the child. I've known women who have started affairs within months of giving birth - I'd say they weren't very good parents (speculating that having an affair means less time with the baby and less commitment to the baby's needs) and perhaps because they didn't attach to their child their hormone levels stayed high enough that seeking out further sexual interests was more attractive than caring for the child. I've known men to do the same thing - start up with another partner after the birth of a child. So maybe it's the bonding with and caring for the baby that reduces hormone levels and enhances actions of commitment. I think it's interesting that this could happen - a biological change that enhances likely survival of the newborn and supports the intellectual and emotional commitments people make when they become close enough that they can produce a baby. Its a biological event that can happen almost without your thinking about it - prior to this study letting you know that it's happening. This makes perfect evolutionary sense - if you want your 'genes' to survive and perhaps procreate in the future then the baby needs to survive. And if you want your personality, values and individual quirks to be carried on into the future then you need to interact with your child - to imprint some of who you are on that little baby.
a classic example of a nyt headline instantly promising the commentary will be more entertaining than the article.

the lowering of testosterone levels in parenting men might also explain why long term married men live longer. high levels of testosterone are associated with both compromised immune systems and high risk behavior. Have kids, do your job, live longer. Not a bad trade compared to random mating behavior, bad choices and early death.
Ah, statistics. You can prove anything and say nothing.

Its not that bad. Study hard, work hard, don't expect others to take care of you, but make sure you give back and help others in need. Start your own businesses and run them they way you think they should be run. Make a difference.

A friend.

Medvedev is toast. The Russians want a dictator with a corrupt government and system. If they didn't, they would rise up on the streets.

As one of the Russian commentators wrote, "My mum's pension is rising every month, Russia (USSR) from the beginning of it's appearance on the world's map was buing wheet and meat from USA Canada and Australia/Now Russian is one of the leading exporters of wheet and many other things that before would not even imagine! 4 times a year Putin was answering emails ,letters and audio-video questions from people oll over Russia (for more than 4 hours continuesly) and made decisions at the monitor immediately/That is why the common people love him !"
To #17 Them or Us: Not only that, between Perry and Romney, I would have sworn it was brought to us by Grecian Formula.

Love the part where Perry says "If you think I can be bought for $5,000, well...." with the implication that it typically costs people/organization much more money to buy influence over him.

That line will come back to haunt him, once people parse what he was saying.

I'd like to ask how much, Rick? What's the going rate?

Amoeba and Sunny have no clue as to what a Ponzi scheme actually is, and their ignorance enables them to guiltlessly support Ranger Rick's embezzlement scheme. Good to see him twisting in the wind after he's been gaffed on this issue by Mitt der Dummheit. Good luck with Florida voters, Ricky old chum.
Rick's only chance of being elected to national office is if we institute a position of National Dog Catcher. I for one would support him for a position in which he drove from town to town in a beat up truck collecting strays for the ASPCA.

Wow. Just finished watching the Republican debate (and then immediately made a donation to the Obama campaign). The opening of this "debate" reminded me of a game show introduction (cue: Merv Griffin). This is the best we've got on the opposition? All would repeal the Affordable Heatlh Care Act and go back to a system where a pre-existing condition could mean a death sentence. Unbelievable. I felt sickened by the applause at the idea that people should turn to their church, instead of a health care system, for monetary help when diagnosed with a life-threatening disease. Who are these callous people who want to be President in 2012? Has anyone, among these candidates, ever had a family member who's been denied care because of a pre-existing condition? And they'd be okay to continue denying that care? And Social Security? Oh, we'll pander to those who are of a certain age (we want their votes) but younger folks, they should be able to opt out and save their own money for their retirement. Oh, because that's what they'll surely do. Invest wisely. And put it where? In the stock market? Oh yes, that'll be a sure thing.

I'm sticking with the pragmatic, thoughtful and intelligent man we already have in the White House, despite the criticism of the progressives who are SO disappointed with Mr. Obama, and the Republicans who have been so determined to make him a one-term president since Day One. And those progressives who might sit at home come November 2012 and not vote at all? Shame on you! Work harder to get the Democrats in the House, the Senate and the White House. Make a difference!
